result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Certificate of Completion - Anger Management filed by Atty Angela Olson. To ELR for review. eif
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission
8 months
#1 letter from Therapist

1:01 PM Defendant Alexandrea Nicole Torres in court.  Attorney Angela Raye Olson in court for Alexandrea Nicole Torres.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#3. 8 month DJOC for Ct#1 and 1 year probation with court costs ($443), 1 day credit if probation is revoked for Ct#3. Dismiss Ct#2 and Ct#4. Court: notes plea questionnaire page 1 had only Ct#3- Atty Olson and Def agree today will be a plea to Ct#1 and Ct#3. Atty Olson and Def agree. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights  Defendant pleas no contest to Ct#1 and Ct#3.Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. ADA Walker: no position to NC plea. Court amends the DJOC to reflect a NC plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#1 and Ct#3. ADA Walker and Atty Olson address sentencing - joint recommendation for DJOC and probation. Victim's rights are in compliance.  Court withholds judgment of conviction in favor of the 8 months DJOC for Ct#1. Court approves the terms/conditions of the DJOC. Court orders S/W 1 year probation on Ct#3- court costs ($443), Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Provide DNA sample within 30 days.  1 day credit if probation is revoked. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Defendant to remain until handed a signed copy of the DJOC. Defendant to report to DOC today. Atty Olson requests exh #1 be sealed. Court orders exh#1 be sealed. 1:20
The original document was titled: Exhibit #1 letter from Therapist
The original history event date is: 09-01-2022

03:05 PM Defendant Alexandrea Nicole Torres in court, in custody.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Scott Selmer appeared in court via phone.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def does qualify for the PD.   Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court verifies the DOB, address and phone # with the defendant.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. DA Hatch: $10,000 signature bond: N/C with Broz Bar in River Falls, N/C with JMD, absolute sobriety,   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs. No entry into any establishment where the primary business is the sale of alcohol. Atty Selmer objects to high bond amount; does not object to conditions. Court orders signature bond as requested. Court reviews bonds conditions with def. 3:23  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
